instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: Hi everyone. I have this board that came in with liquid damage. Damage was around u7000, Q5300 area and U9500. I replaced ISL, Q5300 and resistors in that area as well as U9500 and components in that area. Machine turns on but is very slow to boot into OS and fans throttle high shortly after it is turned on though it doesn't seem to be overheating. When it does boot into OS everything is very slow. It does this on battery and/or on charger & trackpad/KB connected or disconnected. Thank you, have a good day.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: Run ASD EFI version to check for sensor errors. Probably Q5300 corroded trace to it.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: Hey Duke. Ran ASD EFI. Got SMC IO failed error. (TC0D, TC0P, TP0P, TH1H, TH2H, TM0P) The area above the KB and TP connectors is warmer than the CPU GPU area. Thank you.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi. I got a few. I just reposted. Thanks.


* Is it safe to assume that with the multiple errors that the SMC needs to be replaced? But like I said, it does get warm above the KB/TP area.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: Find what is getting hot, something is messing with the SMBUS for the thermal sensors. SMC is probably fine, it is something that is on the SMBUS.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message:
Unfortunately I could not locate the problem. I have been all over SMBUS line. The only thing that I have right now is that pin 1 of U5570 does not stay steady 3.3 v. It jumps very vigorously between 3.33V and 3.26V. I have compared to another working board, and this does not occur. PP3V3_S0 is a steady 3.3V on other test points I have tried. PP3V3_S0 is steady on pin 1 of R5570. When I remove U5570 voltage on pin 1 is steady.Thank you. Have a good one.

*Replaced SMC just in case. Same result like you said.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: If the KB and TP connector area is getting that hot you must be able to find which component it is. It is probably causing all the issues.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: Yea... Though it seems warm in that general area (underside of SMC), there is not one thing that is actually hot. Ive been over everything. Alcohol will evaporate quicker on that area, but its broad and nothing in particular is "hot". Maybe this is just normal behavior and I was going in the wrong direction thinking otherwise. Sorry.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message:
Diode mode on SMBUS_SMC_B_S0_SDA and SCL. Check corrosion around U5570, U5520. Check R5260/61.
Replaced U5570 with another?

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: Hi. Diode mode on pins 9 and 10 of U5570 is .486. Have already replaced U5570, U5520 as well as R5260/61. Thanks. Have a good one.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: Short the data lines together and see if you get the same errors or if there are more.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: data lines as in pins 2,3,4,5. Thanks.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: Data lines going to R5260/61. It is just to make sure we're dealing with the correct SMBUS. Shorting out those data lines will not cause more errors if they already have an issue.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message:
Before I had a chance to shorting out lines the board stopped booting with trackpad plugged in. In the end I ended up replacing U5805 and D5802. Board no longer throttles. However, I now have a very quiet high pitch squeal coming from somewhere, almost like a feed back sound. Seem to be around the center of the board but Im not certain. Squeal seems to change pitch with fans motion. Any thoughts?
Thanks have a good day.

threads.title: 820-2915 Throttling, liquid damage
threads.message: I can not diagnose a noise over the internet....disconnect fans and see if it is gone.
